PageTitle: peer as-number (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view)
FuncDef:
The peer as-number command creates a peer or configures an AS number for a specified peer group.
The undo peer command deletes a specified peer. The peer as-number command creates a peer or configures an AS number for a specified peer group. The undo peer command deletes a specified peer. By default, no BGP peer is configured, and no AS number is specified for a peer or peer group.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address of a peer.
It is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a destination AS number.
For an integral AS number, the value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
For an AS number in dotted notation, the value is in the format of x.y, where x and y are integers ranging from 1 to 65535 and from 0 to 65535, respectively.

ExtraInfo: You can run the peer as-number command to create a specified peer relationship and specify the AS number of the peer.
